verses.verse: Furthermore Elihu <WH453> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559>,
Hear <WH8085> my words <WH4405>, O you wise <WH2450> men <WH238>; and give ear unto me <WH3045>, you that have knowledge.
For the ear <WH241> tries <WH974> words <WH4405>, as the mouth <WH2441> tastes <WH2938> food <WH398>.
Let us choose <WH977> to us judgment <WH4941>: let us know <WH3045> among ourselves what is good <WH2896>.
For Job <WH347> has said <WH559>, I am righteous <WH6663>: and God <WH410> has taken away <WH5493> my judgment <WH4941>.
Should I lie <WH3576> against my right <WH4941>? my wound <WH2671> is incurable <WH605> without transgression <WH6588>.
What man <WH1397> is like Job <WH347>, who drinks up <WH8354> scorning <WH3933> like water <WH4325>?
Which goes <WH732> in company <WH2274> with the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205>, and walks <WH3212> with wicked <WH7562> men <WH582>.
For he has said <WH559>, It profits <WH5532> a man <WH1397> nothing that he should delight <WH7521> himself with God <WH430>.

Therefore listen <WH8085> unto me <WH582>, you men of understanding <WH3824>: far be it <WH2486> from God <WH410>, that he should do wickedness <WH7562>; and from the Almighty <WH7706>, that he should commit iniquity <WH5766>.
For the work <WH6467> of a man <WH120> shall he render <WH7999> unto him <WH376>, and cause every man to find <WH4672> according to his ways <WH734>.
Yes <WH551>, surely God <WH410> will not do wickedly <WH7561>, neither will the Almighty <WH7706> pervert <WH5791> judgment <WH4941>.
Who has given him a charge <WH6485> over the earth <WH776>? or who has disposed <WH7760> the whole world <WH8398>?
If he set <WH7760> his heart <WH3820> upon man <WH622>, if he gather unto himself his spirit <WH7307> and his breath <WH5397>;
All flesh <WH1320> shall perish <WH1478> together <WH3162>, and man <WH120> shall turn again <WH7725> unto dust <WH6083>.
If now you have understanding <WH998>, hear <WH8085> this <WH238>: listen to the voice <WH6963> of my words <WH4405>.
Shall even he that hates <WH8130> right <WH4941> govern <WH2280>? and will you condemn <WH7561> him that is most <WH3524> just <WH6662>?
Is it fit to say <WH559> to a king <WH4428>, You are wicked <WH1100>? and to princes <WH5081>, You are ungodly <WH7563>?

How much less to him that regards <WH5375> not the persons <WH6440> of princes <WH8269>, nor regards <WH5234> the rich <WH7771> more than <WH6440> the poor <WH1800>? for they all are the work <WH4639> of his hands <WH3027>.

In a moment <WH7281> shall they die <WH4191>, and the people <WH5971> shall be troubled <WH1607> at midnight <WH2676>, and pass away <WH5674>: and the mighty <WH47> shall be taken away <WH5493> without hand <WH3027>.
For his eyes <WH5869> are upon the ways <WH1870> of man <WH376>, and he sees <WH7200> all his goings <WH6806>.
There is no darkness <WH2822>, nor shadow of death <WH6757>, where the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> may hide themselves <WH5641>.
For he will not lay <WH7760> upon man <WH376> more than right <WH1980>; that he should enter into judgment <WH4941> with God <WH410>.
He shall break in pieces <WH7489> mighty men <WH3524> without number <WH2714>, and set <WH5975> others in their place <WH312>.
Therefore he knows <WH5234> their works <WH4566>, and he overturns <WH2015> them in the night <WH3915>, so that they are destroyed <WH1792>.
He strikes <WH5606> them as <WH8478> wicked men <WH7563> in the open <WH4725> sight of others <WH7200>;
Because they turned back <WH5493> from him <WH310>, and would not consider <WH7919> any of his ways <WH1870>:
So that they cause the cry <WH6818> of the poor <WH1800> to come <WH935> unto him <WH8085>, and he hears the cry <WH6818> of the afflicted <WH6041>.

When he gives quietness <WH8252>, who then can make trouble <WH7561>? and when he hides <WH5641> his face <WH6440>, who then can behold <WH7789> him <WH1471>? whether it be done against a nation, or against a man <WH120> only <WH3162>:
That the hypocrite <WH120> reign <WH4427> not <WH5971>, lest the people be ensnared <WH4170>.
Surely it is meet to be said <WH559> unto God <WH410>, I have borne <WH5375> chastisement <WH2254>, I will not offend any more:
That which I see <WH2372> not <WH1107> teach <WH3384> you me <WH6466>: if I have done iniquity <WH5766>, I will do no more <WH3254>.
Should it be according to your mind <WH7999>? he will recompense it <WH3588>, whether you refuse, or whether you choose <WH977>; and not I <WH1696>: therefore speak what you know <WH3045>.
Let men <WH582> of understanding <WH3824> tell <WH559> me <WH2450>, and let a wise man <WH1397> listen unto me <WH8085>.
Job <WH347> has spoken <WH1696> outside knowledge <WH1847>, and his words <WH1697> were outside wisdom <WH7919>.
My desire <WH15> is that Job <WH347> may be tried <WH974> unto the end <WH5331> because of his answers <WH8666> for wicked <WH205> men <WH582>.
For he adds <WH3254> rebellion <WH6588> unto his sin <WH2403>, he claps <WH5606> his hands among us <WH7235>, and multiplies his words <WH561> against God <WH410>.
